Wentworth narrowly miss out on points in tense match

Halifax thirds temporarily moved to the top of Group C after a Chris Forrest goal proved the be the only difference between the two sides in a game that could have gone either way.

Good week, bad week: Bayern, Bowden and basketball

By James Bithell

The Nouse Sport team look back at all of this week's highs and lows of the sporting fixtures on campus

Week 6: Sporting news in brief

By James Bithell

All of this week's sporting news in brief from across campus

Women's futsal thrash Middlesbrough

It was a demolition job for the York women's futsal firsts who took their Middlesbrough opponents apart in the Tent last Sunday

York Sport return to old Colours system

By James Bithell

Cass Brown, York Sport President, has returned the Union to the 'Colours' system last used two years ago, after the current system was deemed to be too elitist

UYFC reach FA Futsal Cup semi-finals

The University of York's men's futsal club has made it through to the semi-finals of the futsal FA Cup which will be played in London, qualifying in second place of the quarter-final mini-league after a comfortable 6-4 against the Baltic Alliance on Sunday

University team dominates netball Cup

The University's netball and James College firsts teams continue to top their respective groups after the fourth round of netball College Cup fixtures.

Langwith edge out Vanbrugh

Langwith firsts had an element of luck on their side on Monday, as a late goal from Matt Morton was enough to secure three points against high-flying Vanbrugh seconds

Derwent win in final game on the JLD

Derwent firsts played some excellent football to beat Alcuin firsts in the final College Cup game on the JLD, bringing the era of Cup matches on the surface to an end

Efficient James clinch win from Vanbrugh

A dominant James seconds pulled off a vital victory against a determined Vanbrugh thirds as the Swans chase a place in the Cup qualifications in Group A

Langwith and Wentworth play out goalless draw

Langwith seconds and Wentworth thirds played out a lacklustre goalless draw on the JLD this afternoon

Goodricke thirds salvage a point off Alcuin seconds

An outstanding display from goalkeeper Alex Woolley helped Goodricke thirds to a 1-1 draw against Alcuin seconds in Thursday's Group B match

Fax claim a vital three points off Vanbrugh

A last minute Halifax winner saw them clinch three points in a vital win that levels the playing field out in Group B

Table-topping Derwent thrash Langwith thirds

Table-topping Derwent seconds dismantle Langwith thirds on the JLD in what was always likely to be a tough task for minnows Langwith thirds

Late goal seals James comeback win

James thirds had to dig in deep against Wentworth seconds on Tuesday, but found an extra gear and grabbed a vital late winner.

Late Halifax equaliser stuns Langwith

A last minute equaliser from Sean Kearney secured a well-deserved point for Halifax thirds against Langwith firsts on Tuesday.

Goodricke seal solid victory over Vanbrugh

Goodricke firsts needed the three points in this game having failed to win their opening two matches, and did so by thrashing Vanbrugh seconds 4-1 on the JLD

Postgrads see off unlucky Derwent

Wentworth firsts got off to a flying start which gave them an invaluable lead against Derwent thirds as they won in the JLD sunshine

Goodricke too strong for Alcuin

Goodricke seconds had too much strength against a spirited Alcuin thirds side, eventually running out 3-1 winners on Monday

James turn on style to beat Halifax

James firsts started slowly but eventually turned on the style, thrashing Halifax seconds 8-0 to justify their tag as the tournament favourites

Spoils shared in Hes East derby

A superb strike from Arian Sarrafan earned Langwith firsts a draw with Group C favourites Goodricke on the JLD this afternoon

Halifax see off James in thirds team clash

A sterling second half performance from Halifax thirds took a vital three points from their James counterparts in a 2-0 victory

Derwent breeze past Langwith with ease

Derwent firsts barely needed to get out of first gear, in a dominant performance which saw them destroy Langwith seconds 8-0 on a sunny day on the JLD

Spirited Alcuin snatch draw from James

Ambitious and spirited Alcuin earned a well deserved point from James seconds on the JLD on Thursday

Halifax overcome stern Langwith test

Halifax firsts played some good football to overcome Langwith thirds 4-0, but the heavy scoreline fails to reflect the balance of play

Derwent confidently breeze past Alcuin

Derwent seconds continued their excellent start to their College Cup campaign with a solid 3-0 victory over Alcuin seconds

Vanbrugh maintain ideal start

Vanbrugh overcame a spirited Goodricke thirds side 4-0 on Monday to make it two wins with no goals with no goals conceded from their opening games

Sunderland's Great Escape is not yet complete

Dan Holland assesses what the future might hold for Sunderland after their miraculous escape from relegation

James clinch vital victory off postgrads

In an entertaining game between two firsts teams, James secured a vital 3-0 victory over Wentworth as they continued their dominance over Group D.

By James Bithell
